channel.title: #167: The blog gets posts once every 13 years
channel.description:
Ed and Steve talk about the mental stress of having real-time business metrics, how to find a business mentor, and Steve's attempt to get started with enterprise sales.
And we talk about [the blog that posts very infrequently](https://www.geekproject.com/).
<iframe height="200px" width="100%" frameborder="no" scrolling="no" seamless src="https://player.simplecast.com/6b29ab71-01e4-4539-b4b3-4c99d99fb801?dark=false"></iframe>
You can also [listen, download, and subscribe here](https://bootstrapped.fm/167-the-blog-gets-posts-once-every-13-years/)

item.title: #167: The blog gets posts once every 13 years
item.dc:creator: Kjell-Ake_Gafvelin
item.description:
Not too bad! It’s a complicated name to pronounce for non-nordics!

“Kjell” should be pronounced like “Shell” and the “Å” in “Åke” is easier to replace with “Aa” (long “a”) like “Aake” instead. In Swedish we have a lot of variations of the spelling of the sound for “Sh” as in “Shell”. It could be “Kj”, “Sj”, “Sch”, “Tj” and “K” and they are not interchangeable, it is depending on what word it is. So this is one of the hardest parts when learning Swedish.

Read full topic
item.source: #167: The blog gets posts once every 13 years

item.title: #167: The blog gets posts once every 13 years
item.dc:creator: Kjell-Ake_Gafvelin
item.description:
After recovering from Covid-19 I finally got to listen to this episode! It took a while before I got the title!

I have planned a new post for 2024 with the title “How Saber Feedback and Feature Upvote could acquire UserVoice”!

I’m happy you liked my feedback and implemented the branding changes and that you are thinking about adding a freemium tier.

Read full topic
